alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Douglas, western Arapahoe, Denver, east central Jefferson and southwestern Adams Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 338 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southeastern Denver, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Denver, Aurora, southern Lakewood, Centennial, Highlands Ranch, southern Commerce City, Littleton, Englewood, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, Roxborough Park, Sheridan, Morrison, Louviers, Manila Village, Arapahoe Park, Tiny Town and Chatfield Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
